title: Understanding Import Formats
text: Spreadsheets can handle different types of data files. These are mainly file types that contain plain text or spreadsheet data. Common examples include .txt and .csv files.

title: Navigating Import Options
text: In most spreadsheet applications, there's a feature in the menu called 'File'. From there, you can find an option that allows you to open or import new data.

title: Creating New Spreadsheets
text: When you import data, consider how it will be structured in the spreadsheet. It may not always require creating a new file; often, you can import directly into an existing spreadsheet.

title: Recognizing Compatible File Types
text: Files with formats such as .csv are often used due to their simplicity and versatility. These file types are generally supported by most spreadsheet software for import functions.
